sentences: Ta ei suuda seda teha Ã¼ksi.
context: The word 'suudaks' is a conditional form of the Estonian verb 'suda', which means 'to be able to' or 'to manage'. In this context, it appears in the phrase 'suudaks toita' meaning 'would be able to feed/provide for'. It's used to express possibility or ability under certain conditions. The word is derived from 'suda' (to be able) + '-ks' (conditional suffix).
